com.communote.server.core.security.authentication.confluence

Class ConfluenceAuthenticationToken

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.security.authentication.AbstractAuthenticationToken
      • com.communote.server.core.security.authentication.AbstractCommunoteAuthenticationToken<String>
        • com.communote.server.core.security.authentication.confluence.ConfluenceAuthenticationToken
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Principal, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication, org.springframework.security.core.CredentialsContainer

    public class ConfluenceAuthenticationToken
extends AbstractCommunoteAuthenticationToken<String>
    A token to authenticate a user against Confluence. The actual token string will be available as credentails.
    Author:
    Communote GmbH - http://www.communote.com/
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Allows the creation of a successful authentication.
      ConfluenceAuthenticationToken(String token, boolean sendTokenAsParameter)
      Creates a token for authentication against Confluence.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConfluenceAuthenticationToken

        public ConfluenceAuthenticationToken(Object principal,
                                     String token,
                                     Collection<org.springframework.security.core.GrantedAuthority> authorities)
        Allows the creation of a successful authentication. When the authorities are not null isAuthenticated will return true.
        Parameters:
        principal - the principal
        token - a token for authenticating the user. The token is stored as credentials.
        authorities - the granted authorities

      • ConfluenceAuthenticationToken

        public ConfluenceAuthenticationToken(String token,
                                     boolean sendTokenAsParameter)
        Creates a token for authentication against Confluence.
        Parameters:
        token - a token for authenticating the user. The token is stored as credentials.
        sendTokenAsParameter - true, when the token should be send as POST parameter instead header field.

    • Method Detail

      • isSendTokenAsParameter

        public boolean isSendTokenAsParameter()
        Returns:
        true, when the parameter should be send via post parameter instead via header.
